component.name: Textarea
component.description: Allow the user to enter multi-line freeform text.

useCases: Multi-line text entry in forms (descriptions, comments, notes)
Message composition in chat or messaging interfaces
Any input where line breaks are expected

commonPatterns.name: form-textarea
commonPatterns.description: Standard textarea wrapped in a Field for label and error support

commonPatterns.name: message-input
commonPatterns.description: Textarea inside an InputGroup with a send button

commonPatterns.name: auto-sizing
commonPatterns.description: Textarea that grows with content using field-sizing-content

antiPatterns.reason: Textarea reserves vertical space unnecessarily for single-line values
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Input for single-line text entry

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Textarea without a Field wrapper in forms
antiPatterns.reason: Textarea does not manage labels, descriptions, or error messages
antiPatterns.alternative: Wrap Textarea in Field for complete form semantics

parentConstraints: Wrap in Field for form contexts with label and error support
Use inside InputGroup (as InputGroupTextarea) when paired with addons

interactions.focus: Background shifts from bg-secondary to bg-background; border changes to ring; 2px ring appears
interactions.typing: Uses field-sizing-content CSS — textarea auto-expands as content grows (min-height 64px)
interactions.error: Border and ring turn destructive on aria-invalid

responsive.mobile: Text renders at base size (16px to avoid iOS zoom); full-width

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Tab to focus; type to enter text; Enter adds line breaks; standard text editing shortcuts
accessibility.screenReader: Announced as multi-line text input; requires associated label via Field or aria-label

rules: Textarea handles multi-line text entry only — it does not manage labels or errors
Always pair with Field in forms for proper label and error association
Uses field-sizing-content for auto-expanding height — no manual resize handle needed
Use inside InputGroup (as InputGroupTextarea) when inline controls are needed

aiHints.context: Use for any multi-line text input. Textarea auto-sizes using field-sizing-content with a 64px minimum height. Always wrap in Field for form semantics. For single-line values, use Input instead.
